results.title: New life - new ways
results.brief_description: Examines the potential loneliness and isolation faced by migrant women coming to live in urban Australia. Highlights the many inadequacies of Australian support systems to cope with the special problems of non-English speaking migrant women. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: New lease of life
results.creator_credit: Editorial Film Productions, James Mellor and Guy Blanchard
results.brief_description: Britain’s work in industrial rehabilitation. Follows four typical case histories - a steel erector who has lost a leg in an accident; a clerk who is recovering from a mental breakdown; a young asthmatic with a history of instability; and a secretary, paralysed from the waist down by polio.

results.title: New jig technology
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education, Bruce Shearer and Adrian Harvey
results.brief_description: A program for employees and trainees in the automotive repair industry which looks at the development of two new automotive body repair technologies- dedicated jig systems and universal measuring systems. Both are fully explained and the advantages and disadvantages of each discussed.

results.title: New Jack City
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Doug McHenry, George Jackson and Mario Van Peebles
results.brief_description: This gangster movie for the 90’s has a hard hitting anti drug message, and an enigmatic villain in Nino Brown (Wesley Snipes), a seemingly untouchable drug baron. Brown is a self made man, an entrepreneurial success - the only problem is, he’s made his money from crack. He also has a curious sense of communal loyalty, sharing his wealth with the community around him (and who love him for this generosity), despite supplying a substance that kills. Hot on his tail are the angels, 2 unconventional police officers Scotty and Nick (Ice-T, Judd Nelson) who will stop at nothing to rid the New York City streets of Nino Brown’s power. Brown has converted an abandoned Harlem apartment building into an impenetrable fortress which houses his gang, the Cash Money Brothers. This building must be infiltrated and the only way to do it is to send someone in undercover. Initially they send an ex drug addict (Chris Rock), but when he is unsuccessful, it’s left to Scotty to play the part of a drug dealer and make his way to Nino Brown himself. Cast also includes Vanessa Williams.

results.title: New horizons
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO) in Patzcuaro, Mexico, where teachers from twenty Latin-American countries train to combat illiteracy. The students do their field work in twenty nearby communities, co-operating with various UN agencies. UNESCO emphasises that through their own efforts they can create a better life for their community.
